serviceProviderOrganization.name: Hebburn NHS Trust
serviceProviderOrganization.addr: Hebburn NHS Trust, East View, hebburn, Tyne and Wear, NE31 2TQ

code.displayName: feels drinking is not a problem
able to perform personal care activity
physically unfit to return to work
able to participate in leisure activities
unable to manage personal financial activities

text.paragraph: Assessment Tool Used: Easy-CARE SAP Overview Assessment
Present During Assessment: Mrs Jones' wife - Audrey

td.content: My Disabilities, impairments and other Conditions

paragraph.content: In general would you say your health is (Excellent/ Very good/ Good/ Fair/ Poor)

td.paragraph: Had a stroke a few months ago

paragraph.content: Do you have any problems with your feet?
Can you see?(with glasses if worn)
Can you hear?(with hearing aid if worn)
Do you have any difficulty making yourself understood?
Can you use the telephone?

td.paragraph: Without help, including looking up numbers and dialling

paragraph.content: Can you take your own medication?

td.paragraph: Without help (in the right doses and at the right time).
Wife supervises and puts them into pots. Inhaler technique taught recently by District Nurse - not assessed in A&E.

paragraph.content: Have you had any problems with your skin?

td.paragraph: Currently has whole body itchy rash due to reaction to antibiotics. Prescribed piriton and steroids, advised by A&E to use calamine lotion.

paragraph.content: Do you have any accidents with your bladder?
Do you have any accidents with your bowels?
Can you use the toilet (or commode)?

td.paragraph: Has Mowbray toilet frame and RTS in toilets at home. Uses a bottle at night.

paragraph.content: Do you get out of breath during normal activities?

td.paragraph: Yes - On stairs and on the flat and when bathing

paragraph.content: Do you have any problems with your mouth or teeth?
Have you had any trouble sleeping in the past month?
Have you had much bodily pain in the past month?

section.title: My Mental, Psychological and Emotional wellbeing

paragraph.content: Have you any concerns about memory loss or forgetfulness?
During the last month have you often been bothered by feeling down, depressed or hopeless?
During the last month have you often been bothered by having little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Do you smoke tobacco?
Do you think you drink too much alcohol?

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome – Improved Personal Dignity and Autonomy

paragraph.content: Can you dress yourself?

td.paragraph: Wife helps with buttons, collars and zips.

paragraph.content: Can you keep up your personal appearance?
Can you wash your hands and face?
Can you use the bath or shower?

td.paragraph: Showers himself with wife supervising. Standing tolerance is limited. Needs grab rails fitted to shower – refer to OT.

paragraph.content: Can you do your housework?

td.paragraph: Wife says she does it all.

paragraph.content: Can you prepare your own meals?
Can you feed yourself?
Staying Healthy
Do you have any concerns about your weight or fluid intake
Do you have any special dietary needs?

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome – Improved Personal Dignity and Autonomy

paragraph.content: Can you move yourself from bed to chair?
Can you get around indoors?
Can you manage stairs?

td.paragraph: Pushes up from chair arms, finding it hard at the moment. Uses 1 metal stick. Currently only able to manage short distances on the flat.

paragraph.content: Can you walk outside?
Can you go shopping?
Do you have any difficulty getting to public services?

td.paragraph: Had managed to walk to end of drive by end of last Intermediate Care episode - no longer able to at present. Unable use public transport and so can't get to the doctor's surgery.

paragraph.content: Have you had any falls in the last six months?

td.paragraph: Whilst getting out of the shower.
Desired Outcome - Exercise of Choice and Control
Desired Outcome - Freedom from discrimination or harassment

paragraph.content: Do you feel safe inside your home?
Do you feel safe outside your home?
Is there anyone who would be able to help you in case of illness or emergency?
Do you ever feel threatened or harassed by anyone?

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome - Freedom from discrimination or harassment

paragraph.content: Do you feel discriminated against for any reason?

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome - Improved Quality of Life

paragraph.content: Do you have concerns about the cost of your home?

td.paragraph: Concerned about money, since he had to give up work

paragraph.content: In general are you happy with your accommodation?
Do you have any concerns about the size and space of your home?
Do you have any concerns about the condition of your home?
Do you have any concerns about the location of your home?
In the last year have you had any difficulty keeping your house warm?

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome - Improved Quality of Life

paragraph.content: Do you take regular exercise?
Has your blood pressure been checked recently?
Do you have a flu jab each winter?
Have you had any cancer screening tests in the last three years?

td.paragraph: Desired Outcome - Improved Quality of Life

section.title: Access to Education, Training and Employment

td.content: Access to Education, Training and Employment
td.paragraph: Desired Outcome - Making a positive contribution

td.content: Access to Education, Training and Employment

paragraph.content: Current or previous occupation
Are you currently in employment?
Was your disability/ condition/ injury the cause of you giving up work?

td.paragraph: He would like to get back to work as a warehouseman.
Desired Outcome - Making a positive contribution

paragraph.content: Do you receive any help from any family, friends or neighbours?

td.paragraph: Yes. Friend used to take him out to the pub before this fall

paragraph.content: Your Well-Being
Have you suffered from any recent loss or bereavement?
Are you able to pursue leisure interests, hobbies, work and learning activities which are important to you?
Do you feel lonely?

td.paragraph: Used to enjoy going to football matches. Getting back to work is important.

td.content: My Religious, Cultural and Spiritual Needs

paragraph.content: Are you able to manage your money and financial affairs?
Would you like advice about financial allowances or benefits?
Do you have any specific legal arrangements?

text.paragraph: Following a recent fall in the shower, Barry was admitted to hospital. This assessment was carried out to inform discharge planning. Barry has reduced mobility and requires assistance with personal care, showering. Barry can't mobilise outside and is socially isolated. His long-term aim is to get back into work.
Detail any physical health risk identified: Poor exercise tolerance
What do you consider the level of identified risk to be? Low
Detail any mental health risks you have identified: None
What do you consider the level of identified risk to be? None
Detail any risks from others identified: None
What do you consider the level of identified risk to be? None
Detail any Activities of Daily Living Risks identified: Toileting, washing and dressing are compromised.
What do you consider the level of identified risk to be? Medium
Detail any isolation/access/ environment risks identified: Unable to get out of home at present to maintain social networks.
What do you consider the level of identified risk to be? Medium
Referred to community OT team for assessment.
Plan to discuss smoking cessation options.
Contact Benefits advice team for benefits check and financial assessment
